Returns a normalized value (0..1) for a value 'x' that lies between 'lowerBound' and 'upperBound' using a smooth step function.

Parameters
lowerBound
float

lower bound at which value is 0

upperBound
float

upper bound at which value is 1

float

value to smooth step

Returns

Covariance
double Covariance(
std::
vector<double> 
&
xdata,
std::
vector<double> 
&
ydata,
bool 
useSampleVariance
)

Returns the covariance (-1, 0, +1) for a given set of data The covariance measure the linear relationship between a set of data.  If the data moves together than it is positive. If it moves in opposite direction than it is negative. If it moves in uncorrelated directions it is 0.

Parameters
xdata
std::vector<double>&

x values

ydata
std::vector<double>&

y values

useSampleVariance
bool

indicates whether to compute the sample or population variance

isqrt

uint32 
n
)

Computes the sqrt of an integer via Newtons method without using floating point.  See https://​en​.wikipedia​.org​/wiki​/Integer_square_root for details.

Vector2 
&
p0,
Vector2 
&
p1,
Vector2 
&
p2,
Vector2 
*
pCircumCenter,
float 
*
pRadius
)

Given 3 points of a triangle this function will compute the center and radius of the circle passing through those points

Parameters
p0
Vector2&

first point on circle

p1
Vector2&

second point on circle

p2
Vector2&

third point on circle

pCircumCenter
Vector2*

returns the center of the circumcircle

pRadius
float*

returns the radius of the circumcircle

Types
uint8

An unsigned 8b value

uint16

An unsigned 16b value

uint32

An unsigned 32b value

uint64

An unsigned 64b value

int8

A signed 8b value

int16

A signed 16b value

int32

A signed 32b value

int64

A signed 64b value

float1

A single floating point value. Same as 'float'. Here for symetry with HLSL.

float2

A 2-tuple floating point value.

float3

A 3-tuple floating point value.

float4

A 4-tuple floating point value.

Constants
c_Epsilon

Value considered close to 0.0
